snippet: Mr. Schiffrin championed the work of Jean-Paul Sartre, Günter Grass, Studs Terkel, Michel Foucault, Simone de Beauvoir, Noam Chomsky and many others.
abstract: Andre Schiffrin, publishing force for 50 years, dies at age 78; Schiffrin's passion for editorial independence produced shelves of serious books, a titanic collision with a conglomerate that forced him out to stem losses, and a late-in-life comeback as founder of nonprofit publishing house New Press.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Schiffrin championed the work of Jean-Paul Sartre, Günter Grass, Studs Terkel, Michel Foucault, Simone de Beauvoir, Noam Chomsky and many others.

headline.main: André Schiffrin, Publishing Force and a Founder of New Press, Is Dead at 78
headline.print_headline: André Schiffrin, Publishing Force and a Founder of New Press, Is Dead at 78
